member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenChart
member.summary: Displays line, area, donut, pie, bar or column series.

example.code:
<RadzenChart>
                  <RadzenColumnSeries Data=@revenue CategoryProperty="Quarter" ValueProperty="Revenue" />
              </RadzenChart>
              @code {
                  class DataItem
                  {
                      public string Quarter { get; set; }
                      public double Revenue { get; set; }
                  }
                  DataItem[] revenue = new DataItem[]
                  {
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q1", Revenue = 234000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q2", Revenue = 284000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q3", Revenue = 274000 },
                      new DataItem { Quarter = "Q4", Revenue = 294000 }
                  };
              }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator
member.summary: A validator component which compares a component value with a specified value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenPassword style="display: block" Name="Password" @bind-Value=@model.Password />
               <RadzenPassword style="display: block" Name="RepeatPassword" @bind-Value=@model.RepeatPassword />
               <RadzenCompareValidator Value=@model.Password Component="RepeatPassword" Text="Passwords should be the same"  Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                 public string Password { get; set; }
                 public double Value { get; set; }
                 public string RepeatPassword { get; set; }
               } 
               Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator.Value
member.summary: Specifies the value to compare with.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenCompareValidator.Operator
member.summary: Specifies the comparison operator. Set to CompareOperator.Equal by default.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenEmailValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if a component value is a valid email address. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <RadzenEmailValidator Component="Email" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
              {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenGoogleMap
member.summary: RadzenGoogleMap component.

example.code:
<RadzenGoogleMap Zoom="3" Center=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 42.6977, Lng = 23.3219 }) MapClick=@OnMapClick MarkerClick=@OnMarkerClick">
                <Markers>
                    <RadzenGoogleMapMarker Title="London" Label="London" Position=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 51.5074, Lng = 0.1278 }) />
                    <RadzenGoogleMapMarker Title="Paris " Label="Paris" Position=@(new GoogleMapPosition() { Lat = 48.8566, Lng = 2.3522 }) />
                </Markers>
            </RadzenGoogleMap>
            @code {
              void OnMapClick(GoogleMapClickEventArgs args)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"Map clicked at Lat: {args.Position.Lat}, Lng: {args.Position.Lng}");
              }
              
              void OnMarkerClick(RadzenGoogleMapMarker marker)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"Map {marker.Title} marker clicked. Marker position -> Lat: {marker.Position.Lat}, Lng: {marker.Position.Lng}");
              }
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if then component value length is within a specified range. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="FirstName" @bind-Value=@model.FirstName />
               <RadzenLengthValidator Component="FirstName" Min="3" Text="First name should be at least 3 characters" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                  public string FirstName { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model(); 
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Invalid length" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator.Min
member.summary: Specifies the minimum accepted length. The component value length should be greater than the minimum in order to be valid.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLengthValidator.Max
member.summary: Specifies the maximum accepted length. The component value length should be less than the maximum in order to be valid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenLogin
member.summary: RadzenLogin component. Must be placed in RadzenTemplateForm.

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm Data=@("Login")>
                    <RadzenLogin AllowRegister="true" AllowResetPassword="true"
                                    Login=@OnLogin
                                    ResetPassword=@OnResetPassword
                                    Register=@OnRegister />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
              void OnLogin(LoginArgs args, string name)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Username: {args.Username} and password: {args.Password}");
              }
              
              void OnRegister(string name)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> Register");
              }
              
              void OnResetPassword(string value, string name)
              {
                Console.WriteLine($"{name} -> ResetPassword for user: {value}");
              }
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRegexValidator
member.summary: A validator component which matches a component value against a specified regular expression pattern. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
               <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="ZIP" @bind-Value=@model.Zip />
               <RadzenRegexValidator Component="ZIP" Text="ZIP code must be 5 digits" Pattern="\d{5}" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
               class Model
               {
                  public string Zip { get; set; }
               }
               Model model = new Model(); 
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRegexValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Value should match" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRegexValidator.Pattern
member.summary: Specifies the regular expression pattern which the component value should match in order to be valid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRequiredValidator
member.summary: A validator component which checks if a component has value. Must be placed inside a

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
             {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRequiredValidator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the message displayed when the component is invalid. Set to "Required" by default.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenRequiredValidator.DefaultValue
member.summary: Specifies a default value. If the component value is equal to DefaultValue it is considered invalid.

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1
member.summary: Displays a collection of in day, week or month view.
member.typeparam: The type of the value item.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data="@data" TItem="DataItem" StartProperty="Start" EndProperty="End" TextProperty="Text">
                <RadzenMonthView />
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
                class DataItem
                {
                    public DateTime Start { get; set; }
                    public DateTime End { get; set; }
                    public string Text { get; set; }
                }
                DataItem[] data = new DataItem[]
                {
                    new DataItem
                    {
                        Start = DateTime.Today,
                        End = DateTime.Today.AddDays(1),
                        Text = "Birthday"
                    },
                };
            }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.SlotSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks a slot in the current view. Commonly used to add new appointments.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentSelect
member.summary: A callback that will be invoked when the user clicks an appointment in the current view. Commonly used to edit existing appointments.

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.AppointmentRender
member.summary: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an appointment. Never call StateHasChanged when handling AppointmentRender.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments AppointmentRender=@OnAppointmentRendert>
             </RadzenScheduler>
             @code {
               void OnAppintmentRender(SchedulerAppointmentRenderEventArgs<TItem> args) 
               {
                 if (args.Data.Text == "Birthday")
                 {
                    args.Attributes["style"] = "color: red;"
                 }
            .  }
             }

member.name: P:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenScheduler`1.SlotRender
member.summary: An action that will be invoked when the current view renders an slot. Never call StateHasChanged when handling SlotRender.

example.code:
<RadzenScheduler Data=@appointments SlotRender=@OnSlotRender>
            </RadzenScheduler>
            @code {
              void OnSlotRender(SchedulerSlotRenderEventArgs args) 
              {
                if (args.View.Text == "Month" && args.Start.Date == DateTime.Today)
                {
                   args.Attributes["style"] = "background: red;";
                }
              }
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenTemplateForm`1
member.summary: A component which represents a form. Provides validation support.

example.code:
<RadzenTemplateForm TItem="Model" Data=@model>
              <RadzenTextBox style="display: block" Name="Email" @bind-Value=@model.Email />
              <RadzenRequiredValidator Component="Email" Text="Email is required" Style="position: absolute" />
            </RadzenTemplateForm>
            @code {
             class Model
             {
               public string Email { get; set; }
             }
             
             Model model = new Model();
            }

member.name: T:Radzen.Blazor.RadzenUpload
member.summary: RadzenUpload component.

example.code:
<RadzenUpload Url="upload/single" Progress=@(args => OnProgress(args, "Single file upload"))/>
             @code {
              void OnProgress(UploadProgressArgs args, string name)
              {
                this.info = $"% '{name}' / {args.Loaded} of {args.Total} bytes.";
                this.progress = args.Progress;
                if (args.Progress == 100)
                {
                    console.Clear();
            
                    foreach (var file in args.Files)
                    {
                        console.Log($"Uploaded: {file.Name} / {file.Size} bytes");
                    }
                }
              }
             }

member.summary: Class NotificationService. Contains various methods with options to open notifications. Should be added as scoped service in the application services and RadzenNotification should be added in application main layout.
